contentrichtext.text: {{for|the airport in [[Bogotá]], [[Colombia]]|El Dorado International Airport}} {{Infobox airport | name = Dorado Airport | image = | IATA = DDP | ICAO = | FAA = | type = | owner = | operator = | city-served = | location = [[Dorado, Puerto Rico]] | elevation-f = | elevation-m = | latd = 18 | latm = 27 | lats = 52 | latNS = N | longd= 066 | longm= 17 | longs= 33 | longEW= W | coordinates_region = US-PR | pushpin_map = Puerto Rico | pushpin_label = DPP | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Puerto Rico | website = | r1-number = 10/28 | r1-length-f = 3,500 | r1-surface = Paved | footnotes = Sources: IATA,<ref name=GCM>[http://gc.kls2.com/airport/DDP Great Circle Mapper: DDP - Dorado, Puerto Rico (Dorado Beach Airport)]</ref> coordinates,<ref name=TopoZone>[http://www.topoquest.com/map.asp?lat=18.4644&lon=-66.2925&size=m&s=24 TopoQuest: Dorado Airport]</ref> runway,<ref name=Freeman>[http://www.airfields-freeman.com/PR/Airfields_PR_E.html#dorado] [[Abandoned & Little-Known Airfields]]: Eastern Puerto Rico: Dorado</ref> well<ref name=Spaced>[http://www.doradobeachclubs.com/dorado.asp?id=488&page=24791 Dorado Beach History]</ref> }} '''Dorado Airport''' or '''Dorado Beach Airport''' {{Airport codes|DDP}}<ref name=GCM /> was a small single runway airport in [[Dorado, Puerto Rico|Dorado]], [[Puerto Rico]]. [[Clara Livingston]], at the time owner of the property, ordered the strip to be built, and her friend, [[Amelia Earhart]], may have used the facility as well.<ref name=Spaced /> Later on, the [[United States]] military, during [[World War II]], paved the runway.<ref name=Freeman /> Much later on, a large airline named [[Caribair (Puerto Rico)|Caribair]] (later overtaken by [[Eastern Air Lines]]), began flights there. When Caribair became part of Eastern, flights to Dorado Airport were suspended. During the early 1980s, Dorado was served by [[Dorado Wings]], a small airline that operated commuter flights between Dorado Airport and [[Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport]] in [[San Juan, Puerto Rico|San Juan]]. The airline operated propeller airplanes. In the early 1990s, the airport was officially closed. In 1996, the parcel was rezoned and construction commenced of a master planned community: Dorado Beach East. In memory of Dorado Airport and its founder, Ms. Clara Livingston, the developers built a children's playground themed with unique play airplanes, a hangar for activities, and a runway plaza. == References == <references /> {{Portal|Puerto Rico}} ==External links== *[http://msrmaps.com/map.aspx?lat=18.4644&lon=-66.2925&s=11&w=700&h=350&g=1 MSR Maps: Dorado Airport] ([[USGS]] aerial photo dated 24 November 1994 showing closed runway with X's). *[http://www.world-airport-codes.com/puerto-rico/dorado-beach-1975.html World Airport Codes: Dorado Beach Airport (DDP)]. <!--Templates--><br/> {{Airports in Puerto Rico}} [[Category:Dorado, Puerto Rico]] [[Category:Airports in Puerto Rico]] [[Category:Defunct airports in Puerto Rico]]
